dict.string: A unique identifier for the payload, dot-delimited. Usually root PayloadIdentifier+subidentifier
The type of the payload, a reverse dns string
The version of the whole configuration profile.
This value describes the issuing organization of the profile, as displayed to the user
Dictionary of accessibility shortcuts that are either accessible or not from the accessibility shortcut menu: ⌥ Option + ⌘ Command + F5.
Flash the screen when an alert sound occurs
Use scroll gesture with modifier keys to zoom
Speak items under pointer after delay
Mouse Cursor Size. 1 is normal, 4 is maximum.
Show preview rectangle when zoomed out
Hold ^⌘ to temporarily detach zoom view from pointer
Flash screen when notification banner appears outside zoom window

array.string: Only when the pointer reaches an edge
So the pointer is at or near the center of the screen

dict.string: When zoomed in, the screen image moves ...
VoiceOver provides spoken and brailled descriptions of items on the computer screen and provides control of the computer through the user of the keyboard.
Mouse Keys allows the mouse pointer to be controlled using the keyboard number pad.
Ignore built-in trackpad when Mouse Keys is on
The Accessibility Keyboard lets you type and interact with macOS without using a hardware keyboard.
Preference fades the accessibility keyboard panel after configured dwellHideUITimeout seconds.
Fades the accessibility keyboard panel after X seconds of inactivity.
Fade Accessbility Keyboard panel after inactivity
Preference sets the fade percentage of the Accessibility Keyboard after X seconds of inactivity.
Play key sounds for Accessibility Keyboard
Determines whether Accessibility Keyboard keys are entered when the mouse is pressed down or when the mouse is released.
Press the Option key five times to toggle Mouse Keys
Show dwell actions in menu bar
The number of seconds can be increments of .25.
Keyboard action to be taken when the default dwell time has been reached.
The number of seconds can be increments of .25.
The number of seconds can be increments of .25.
The number of pixels can be entered to the nearest hundreth - ex. 45.45.
Pick the one time action to be performed after dwelling on a screen corner.
Yes, the integer range list DOES NOT include a value of 5
Yes, the integer range list DOES NOT include a value of 5
Yes, the integer range list DOES NOT include a value of 5
Yes, the integer range list DOES NOT include a value of 5
Allow Panel to Follow Triggered Hot Corner
Sticky keys allows modifier keys to be set without having to hold the key down.
If enabled, will beep when sticky keys are also enabled.
Beep when a modifier key is set
Slow keys adjusts the amount of time between when a key is pressed and when it is activated
Turn on click key sounds for slow keys
Press the Shift key five times to toggle Sticky Keys
Where to display the pressed sticky keys on screen.
Switch Control allows the computer to be controlled using one or more switches. These can be mouse, keyboard, gamepad buttons or dedicated devices.
Hide Switch Control panel after inactivity
The number of seconds can be entered to the nearest hundreth - ex. 45.45.
Time of inactivity to hide switch control panel
The minimum time required to hold Switch Control.
The minimum time required to hold Switch Control. The number of seconds can be entered to the nearest hundreth - ex. 45.45.
Time required to hold down the Switch Control key before repeating. The number of seconds can be entered to the nearest hundreth - ex. 45.45.

Enable this preference to speak selection while navigating. Set this and switchPlaySounds to both speak selection and play sounds while navigating. Set both to `false` to do nothing while navigating.
switchSpeakSelectedElement = true & switchPlaySounds = false == Speak selection switchPlaySounds = true & switchSpeakSelectedElement = false == Play sounds switchSpeakSelectedElement = true & switchPlaySounds = true == Speak & play sounds

Enable this preference to play sounds while navigating. Enable this and switchSpeakSelectedElement to both speak selection and play sounds while navigating. Set both to `false` to do nothing while navigating.
switchPlaySounds = true & switchSpeakSelectedElement = false == Play sounds switchSpeakSelectedElement = true & switchPlaySounds = false == Speak selection switchPlaySounds = true & switchSpeakSelectedElement = true == Speak & play sounds
Values can only be whole numbers.
Values can be decimals to the nearest hundreth - ex. 5.45
Values can be decimals to the nearest hundreth - ex. 5.45
Values can be decimals to the nearest hundreth - ex. 5.45
